title: Opening prysm ui while processing deposits
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description When opening prysm UI while beacon is still processing deposit logs and error appears in the logs. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? don't know ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Start beacon from scratch, no db. Prysm will start processing deposits. Then open up Prysm UI ## üî• Error 

time="2021-07-07 16:48:00" level=error msg="gRPC panicked!" error="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference" stack="goroutine 80441 [running]:
runtime/debug.Stack(0xc0000b0000, 0x5d857e, 0x5)

google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).processUnaryRPC(0xc000b9ca80, 0x9639b8, 0xc0002ca900, 0xc0015539e0, 0xc00c2fea50, 0x24286e0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Ubuntu 20.4
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
1.3.11
with [Stereum Node Setup](https://stereum.net/ethereum-node-setup/)

Looks like a bug where this bit of code has a nil head state

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/4ebb008bc9a1f6a89ac45929d87d180aa25ffd1e/beacon-chain/rpc/prysm/v1alpha1/beacon/validators.go#L216-L230

An appropriate fix would be to handle a nil `reqState` and return a relevant error to the client.
